Class Note

java.lang.Object
  Note

public class Note
extends java.lang.Object

Class which creates a flute note with a frequence we can define. As for the sampling rate, it is fixed at 44100 Hz.

Constructor Summary
Note()
          Default constructor Here, the frequency is defined at 440 Hz.
Note(int f)
          Constructor of Note It uses the methods created below.
 
Method Summary
 void chronogramme()
          chronogramme method Calculates the digital timing diagram of the signal, by applying the envelope on the signal synth calculated before.
 Complex[] complexSignal()
          complexSignal method Creates a array of Complex where the real parts are the ordinates of the signal and the imaginary parts are all null.
 void env()
          env methode Creates the envelope matching a flute note.
static void fileWrite(double[] array, java.lang.String name)
          fileWrite method Creates a file using a double array and the name (string) of the file
 void freqHarmoniques()
          freqHarmonique method Calculates the frequency for each harmonic from f0 = f and places the results in an array tf[] of the same size of CHO (array containing the coefficients of the harmonics)
 void play()
          play method Plays the sound
 void synth()
          synth method Calculates the ordinates of the signal for each discrete time (thus, there will be FE+1 values)
 void tempsDiscret()
          tempsDiscret method Establishes an array containing the discrete times which has the form : 0, 1/FE, 2/FE, 3/FE, 4/FE ...
 void toByteArray()
          toByteArray method Create an byte array in order to allow the method "play" to play the sound
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Note

public Note(int f)
Constructor of Note It uses the methods created below.

Parameters:
f - Frequency of the note we want to create.

Note

public Note()
Default constructor Here, the frequency is defined at 440 Hz.

Method Detail

freqHarmoniques

public void freqHarmoniques()
freqHarmonique method Calculates the frequency for each harmonic from f0 = f and places the results in an array tf[] of the same size of CHO (array containing the coefficients of the harmonics)

tempsDiscret

public void tempsDiscret()
tempsDiscret method Establishes an array containing the discrete times which has the form : 0, 1/FE, 2/FE, 3/FE, 4/FE ...

synth

public void synth()
synth method Calculates the ordinates of the signal for each discrete time (thus, there will be FE+1 values)

env

public void env()
env methode Creates the envelope matching a flute note.

chronogramme

public void chronogramme()
chronogramme method Calculates the digital timing diagram of the signal, by applying the envelope on the signal synth calculated before.

complexSignal

public Complex[] complexSignal()
complexSignal method Creates a array of Complex where the real parts are the ordinates of the signal and the imaginary parts are all null. This array will allow to create an FFT.

fileWrite

                             java.lang.String name)
fileWrite method Creates a file using a double array and the name (string) of the file

Parameters:
array -
name - of the file

toByteArray

public void toByteArray()
toByteArray method Create an byte array in order to allow the method "play" to play the sound

public void play()
play method Plays the sound
